comment:
This Dior thing isn't the only win Depp's getting. It's been revealed that Johnny Depp is not only involved with the Hollywood vampires' third album, but is also collaborating with guitarist Jeff Beck for Beck's new album. From what it appears, Depp's focus is currently on making music. He wants a return to acting in the future but for now he wants to mainly make and perform songs. 

The only bullshit setback is that Minamata, Depp's latest film, isn't being released in America because the studio that was going to distribute it is now pussing out because of the "controversy". But im pretty sure that the film will become accessible online after it comes out I the UK in August.

I'll keep saying it: Depp being dropped from the Wizarding World and POTC franchises is a blessing on disguise. Even when Depp was in them, they were going downhill and losing their quality. Dead Men Tell No Tales was the worst of POTC, and even Depp couldn't save it. Crimes of Grindelwald was the same thing for the Wizarding World franchise. Depp and Jude Law were the only good parts of that film. Depp should do more stuff like The Proffesor and Waiting for the Barbarians, rather then shitty Hollywood films like FB 3.

comment: I think Mads is trying to make it clear that he took this job as an actor. He's trying to be respectful to the fan base Fantastic Beasts has, by expressing that he won't even try to fill JD's shoes, he just wants to do a good job. He doesn't agree with the company status quo and he doesn't want to be compared to JD. Which is fair, because he is an excellent actor in his own right. Terrible that you get a job because a company decides to take allegations as gospel and attempts to destroy another actors career.
